verses.kjv: And Samuel died; and all the Israelites were gathered together, and lamented him, and buried him in his house at Ramah. And David arose, and went down to the wilderness of Paran.
verses.ct: Samuel died, and all of Israel gathered together to mourn for him. They buried him at his home in Ramah. After that, David headed down to the wilderness of Paran.

verses.kjv: And there was a man in Maon, whose possessions were in Carmel; and the man was very great, and he had three thousand sheep, and a thousand goats: and he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.
verses.ct: There was a man in Maon who had property in Carmel. He was very wealthy, owning 3,000 sheep and 1,000 goats. At that time, he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.

verses.kjv: Now the name of the man was Nabal; and the name of his wife Abigail: and she was a woman of good understanding, and of a beautiful countenance: but the man was churlish and evil in his doings; and he was of the house of Caleb.
verses.ct: The man's name was Nabal, and his wife's name was Abigail. She was an intelligent and beautiful woman, but he was harsh and cruel in everything he did. He was a descendant of Caleb.

verses.kjv: And David heard in the wilderness that Nabal did shear his sheep.
verses.ct: While David was in the wilderness, he heard that Nabal was shearing his sheep.

verses.kjv: And David sent out ten young men, and David said unto the young men, Get you up to Carmel, and go to Nabal, and greet him in my name:
verses.ct: So David sent 10 young men with these instructions: "Go up to Carmel, find Nabal, and give him my greetings.

verses.kjv: And thus shall ye say to him that liveth in prosperity, Peace be both to thee, and peace be to thine house, and peace be unto all that thou hast.
verses.ct: Say to him: 'May you have a long life! Peace to you, peace to your family, and peace to everything you own.

verses.kjv: And now I have heard that thou hast shearers: now thy shepherds which were with us, we hurt them not, neither was there ought missing unto them, all the while they were in Carmel.
verses.ct: I've heard that you're shearing your sheep right now. When your shepherds were near us, we never harmed them, and nothing of theirs went missing the entire time they were in Carmel.

verses.kjv: Ask thy young men, and they will shew thee. Wherefore let the young men find favour in thine eyes: for we come in a good day: give, I pray thee, whatsoever cometh to thine hand unto thy servants, and to thy son David.
verses.ct: Ask your own workers, and they'll confirm this. So please show kindness to my men, since we've come at a time of celebration. Please give whatever you can spare to your servants and to your son David.'"

verses.kjv: And when David’s young men came, they spake to Nabal according to all those words in the name of David, and ceased.
verses.ct: When David's young men arrived, they delivered this entire message to Nabal on David's behalf, and then they waited.

verses.kjv: And Nabal answered David’s servants, and said, Who is David? and who is the son of Jesse? there be many servants now a days that break away every man from his master.
verses.ct: But Nabal responded to David's servants by saying, "Who is David? Who is this son of Jesse? These days, all kinds of slaves are running away from their masters."

verses.kjv: Shall I then take my bread, and my water, and my flesh that I have killed for my shearers, and give it unto men, whom I know not whence they be?
verses.ct: "Why should I take my bread, my water, and the meat I've butchered for my shearers and give it to men who come from who knows where?"

verses.kjv: So David’s young men turned their way, and went again, and came and told him all those sayings.
verses.ct: So David's young men turned around, went back, and reported everything Nabal had said.

verses.kjv: And David said unto his men, Gird ye on every man his sword. And they girded on every man his sword; and David also girded on his sword: and there went up after David about four hundred men; and two hundred abode by the stuff.
verses.ct: David told his men, "Everyone strap on your sword!" So each man put on his sword, and David strapped on his as well. About 400 men went with David, while 200 stayed behind to guard the supplies.

verses.kjv: But one of the young men told Abigail, Nabal’s wife, saying, Behold, David sent messengers out of the wilderness to salute our master; and he railed on them.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, one of the servants told Nabal's wife Abigail, "David sent messengers from the wilderness to greet our master, but he screamed insults at them.

verses.kjv: But the men were very good unto us, and we were not hurt, neither missed we any thing, as long as we were conversant with them, when we were in the fields:
verses.ct: Yet those men treated us very well. We were never harmed, and we never lost a single thing the whole time we were out in the fields with them.

verses.kjv: They were a wall unto us both by night and day, all the while we were with them keeping the sheep.
verses.ct: They were like a protective wall around us day and night the entire time we were with them watching the sheep.

verses.kjv: Now therefore know and consider what thou wilt do; for evil is determined against our master, and against all his household: for he is such a son of Belial, that a man cannot speak to him.
verses.ct: So think carefully about what you should do, because disaster is heading straight for our master and his whole household. He's such a worthless man that nobody can even talk to him."

verses.kjv: Then Abigail made haste, and took two hundred loaves, and two bottles of wine, and five sheep ready dressed, and five measures of parched corn, and an hundred clusters of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs, and laid them on asses.
verses.ct: Abigail acted quickly. She gathered 200 loaves of bread, 2 skins of wine, 5 prepared sheep, 5 measures of roasted grain, 100 clusters of raisins, and 200 cakes of figs, and loaded them onto donkeys.

verses.kjv: And she said unto her servants, Go on before me; behold, I come after you. But she told not her husband Nabal.
verses.ct: She told her servants, "Go on ahead of me. I'll be right behind you." But she didn't tell her husband Nabal anything about it.

verses.kjv: And it was so, as she rode on the ass, that she came down by the covert of the hill, and, behold, David and his men came down against her; and she met them.
verses.ct: As she was riding her donkey down a hidden path along the hill, David and his men were coming toward her from the other direction, and she met them.

verses.kjv: Now David had said, Surely in vain have I kept all that this fellow hath in the wilderness, so that nothing was missed of all that pertained unto him: and he hath requited me evil for good.
verses.ct: David had been saying to himself, "I protected everything that man owns out in the wilderness for nothing — not a single thing of his went missing — and he has repaid my kindness with insults.

verses.kjv: So and more also do God unto the enemies of David, if I leave of all that pertain to him by the morning light any that pisseth against the wall.
verses.ct: May God deal with David's enemies severely if I leave even one male in Nabal's household alive by morning."

verses.kjv: And when Abigail saw David, she hasted, and lighted off the ass, and fell before David on her face, and bowed herself to the ground,
verses.ct: When Abigail saw David, she quickly got off her donkey, fell on her face in front of David, and bowed down to the ground.

verses.kjv: And fell at his feet, and said, Upon me, my lord, upon me let this iniquity be: and let thine handmaid, I pray thee, speak in thine audience, and hear the words of thine handmaid.
verses.ct: She fell at his feet and said, "My lord, let the blame fall on me. Please let your servant speak to you, and listen to what I have to say.

verses.kjv: Let not my lord, I pray thee, regard this man of Belial, even Nabal: for as his name is, so is he; Nabal is his name, and folly is with him: but I thine handmaid saw not the young men of my lord, whom thou didst send.
verses.ct: Please don't pay any attention to that worthless man Nabal. His name means 'fool,' and he lives up to it. But I, your servant, didn't see the young men you sent.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, my lord, as the LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, seeing the LORD hath withholden thee from coming to shed blood, and from avenging thyself with thine own hand, now let thine enemies, and they that seek evil to my lord, be as Nabal.
verses.ct: Now my lord, as surely as the LORD lives and as you yourself live, the LORD has held you back from shedding blood and taking revenge with your own hand. May your enemies and everyone who wants to harm you end up like Nabal.

verses.kjv: And now this blessing which thine handmaid hath brought unto my lord, let it even be given unto the young men that follow my lord.
verses.ct: Please accept this gift that your servant has brought for you, and let it be given to the young men who follow you.

verses.kjv: I pray thee, forgive the trespass of thine handmaid: for the LORD will certainly make my lord a sure house; because my lord fighteth the battles of the LORD, and evil hath not been found in thee all thy days.
verses.ct: Please forgive your servant's boldness. The LORD will certainly establish a lasting dynasty for you, because you fight the LORD's battles, and no wrongdoing has been found in you throughout your life.

verses.kjv: Yet a man is risen to pursue thee, and to seek thy soul: but the soul of my lord shall be bound in the bundle of life with the LORD thy God; and the souls of thine enemies, them shall he sling out, as out of the middle of a sling.
verses.ct: Even though someone is pursuing you and trying to take your life, your life will be safely held in the LORD your God's keeping. But the lives of your enemies — he will hurl them away like stones from a sling.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, when the LORD shall have done to my lord according to all the good that he hath spoken concerning thee, and shall have appointed thee ruler over Israel;
verses.ct: When the LORD has done for you everything good that he has promised, and has made you ruler over Israel,

verses.kjv: That this shall be no grief unto thee, nor offence of heart unto my lord, either that thou hast shed blood causeless, or that my lord hath avenged himself: but when the LORD shall have dealt well with my lord, then remember thine handmaid.
verses.ct: you won't have this weighing on your conscience — the guilt of having shed innocent blood or of having taken revenge yourself. And when the LORD has blessed you, my lord, please remember your servant."

verses.kjv: And David said to Abigail, Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, which sent thee this day to meet me:
verses.ct: David said to Abigail, "Praise the LORD, the God of Israel, who sent you to meet me today!

verses.kjv: And blessed be thy advice, and blessed be thou, which hast kept me this day from coming to shed blood, and from avenging myself with mine own hand.
verses.ct: And praise your good judgment! May you be blessed for keeping me today from shedding blood and taking revenge with my own hand.

verses.kjv: For in very deed, as the LORD God of Israel liveth, which hath kept me back from hurting thee, except thou hadst hasted and come to meet me, surely there had not been left unto Nabal by the morning light any that pisseth against the wall.
verses.ct: Because as surely as the LORD, the God of Israel, lives — the one who held me back from harming you — if you hadn't hurried to meet me, not a single male in Nabal's household would have been left alive by morning."

verses.kjv: So David received of her hand that which she had brought him, and said unto her, Go up in peace to thine house; see, I have hearkened to thy voice, and have accepted thy person.
verses.ct: Then David accepted what she had brought him and said to her, "Go home in peace. I've listened to what you said and granted your request."

verses.kjv: And Abigail came to Nabal; and, behold, he held a feast in his house, like the feast of a king; and Nabal’s heart was merry within him, for he was very drunken: wherefore she told him nothing, less or more, until the morning light.
verses.ct: When Abigail returned to Nabal, he was throwing a feast in his house fit for a king. He was in high spirits and completely drunk, so she told him absolutely nothing until the next morning.

verses.kjv: But it came to pass in the morning, when the wine was gone out of Nabal, and his wife had told him these things, that his heart died within him, and he became as a stone.
verses.ct: In the morning, after Nabal had sobered up, his wife told him everything that had happened. His heart failed inside him, and he became paralyzed like a stone.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass about ten days after, that the LORD smote Nabal, that he died.
verses.ct: About 10 days later, the LORD struck Nabal, and he died.

verses.kjv: And when David heard that Nabal was dead, he said, Blessed be the LORD, that hath pleaded the cause of my reproach from the hand of Nabal, and hath kept his servant from evil: for the LORD hath returned the wickedness of Nabal upon his own head. And David sent and communed with Abigail, to take her to him to wife.
verses.ct: When David heard that Nabal was dead, he said, "Praise the LORD, who has defended my honor against Nabal's insults and kept his servant from doing wrong. The LORD has brought Nabal's wickedness back down on his own head." Then David sent a message to Abigail, proposing marriage to her.

verses.kjv: And when the servants of David were come to Abigail to Carmel, they spake unto her, saying, David sent us unto thee, to take thee to him to wife.
verses.ct: When David's servants came to Abigail at Carmel, they told her, "David has sent us to bring you to him to be his wife."

verses.kjv: And she arose, and bowed herself on her face to the earth, and said, Behold, let thine handmaid be a servant to wash the feet of the servants of my lord.
verses.ct: She got up, bowed with her face to the ground, and said, "Your servant is ready — even to wash the feet of my lord's servants."

verses.kjv: And Abigail hasted, and arose, and rode upon an ass, with five damsels of hers that went after her; and she went after the messengers of David, and became his wife.
verses.ct: Abigail quickly got up, mounted her donkey, and with 5 of her female attendants following her, she went with David's messengers and became his wife.

verses.kjv: David also took Ahinoam of Jezreel; and they were also both of them his wives.
verses.ct: David had also married Ahinoam from Jezreel, so both of them were his wives.

verses.kjv: But Saul had given Michal his daughter, David’s wife, to Phalti the son of Laish, which was of Gallim.
verses.ct: But Saul had given his daughter Michal, who was David's wife, to Phalti son of Laish, who was from Gallim.
